intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to create your authentication token.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the g-Eclipse user perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > g-Eclipse (User) or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Select the Authentication Tokens View
item.description: Select the Authentication Tokens tab in the bottom panel view.

item.title: Click the New icon
item.description: Click the New icon located in the top right corner of the Authentication Tokens panel view.

item.title: Choose the Token Type
item.description:
Once you clicked the new icon, a New Authentication Token window will appear. Make your selection by choosing between Grid Proxy and VOMS Proxy and click the Next button.
Note that you may bypass this dialog box if you carefully click the downward pointing arrow of the New icon. In this case, the kinds of proxy appear in a pull down menu, allowing you to make the selection directly from here.

item.title: Grid Proxy: Locate Your Certificate
item.description: After clicking the Next button, the Grid Proxy dialog box will appear. Specify the location of your key and certificate and enter your key passphrase. In this dialog box, you may also adjust how long will the proxy be valid. By default, this Proxy Lifetime value is set to 1 day.

item.title: Create Your Token
item.description: Press finish and your proxy will be validated and will appear as an entry in the Authentication Tokens panel view.

item.title: Activate Your Token
item.description: Activate this token by first clicing on the token entry in the Activation Tokens panel view (this makes button with a pedlock icon visible) and then click the Activation button on the top right of this panel view.
